intro: Styphelia salicifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in heathland or scrub environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Styphelia salicifolia is adapted to coastal conditions, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
